title: Event
description: An action that occurs at some location during some time. Derived from dwc Class event (http://rs.tdwg.org/dwc/terms/version/Event-2018-09-06). This class has been defined under the ltc namespace because it only has a subset of the properties of DwC:Event. All ltc:Event properties are borrowed from and reference the dwc namespace. Examples of an Event include: A specimen collection process. A camera trap image capture. A marine trawl.

properties.name: eventName
properties.description: The name commonly used to identify or refer to the event.

properties.name: habitat
properties.description: A category or description of the habitat in which the Event occurred.

properties.name: hasIdentifier
properties.description: This property refers to one or more related instances of the Identifier class.

properties.name: hasMeasurementOrFact
properties.description: This property refers to one or more related instances of the MeasurementOrFact class.

properties.name: hasPersonRole
properties.description: This property refers to one or more related instances of the PersonRole class.

properties.name: hasReference
properties.description: This property refers to one or more related instances of the Reference class.

properties.name: hasTemporalCoverage
properties.description: This property refers to one or more related instances of the TemporalCoverage class.

properties.name: samplingProtocol
properties.description: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event

properties.name: verbatimEventDate
properties.description: The verbatim original representation of the date and time information for an Event.
